data.title: Shift + f1 should always open help
data.body:
I think it would be great if shift+f1 could always open help popup. Currently there is no way to quickly open help f you are not in text editor (lets say I'm looking at 3d scene, and I'm wondering how some concrete node works). And even in text editor you need to select _something_, for this shortcut to work.
I'm quite sure there was a way to open help with keyboard in 1.1

data.title: Add option to create navigation mesh inside the editor itself.
data.body:
If we need navigation in a level, we need to create the whole level in blender and create a navmesh and import it all along to the editor. 
Then later on, if we need to change the position of an object, we need to recreate the navmesh for that in blender(or any 3d application) and re import it.

If we can create the navmesh by a simple click of a button, similar to Unity, it would be better I think.
Thanks.

data.title: Android 2.3 compatibility [broken in 2.0, worked in 1.1]
data.body:
AndroidManifest.xml specifies **minimum API level 10** (corresponding to Android 2.3), so naturally one would assume that Godot would work on **Android 2.3** devices, but when I test a **Godot 2.0** app on what Godot identifies as "**Cingular Us HTC Holiday**" (ARMv7) it **fails silently**. When I install from storage, it says that there was a **problem parsing the package**.

I am able to run everything **without issue on Android 4.x devices**. (The only other difference is that the SD card for the 2.3 device is currently misplaced while the other two have SD cards.)

[image of my unscientific comparison: http://i.imgur.com/1KE8giM.png ]

Interestingly, **without the export templates** installed I was **able to install apps on 2.3** but of course they just gave me a **flashing grey screen** as there was no engine.

(Note: I don't have high expectations for the device as one of my rich neighbors left it in a freebie bin, and it may not represent all Android 2.3 devices, but I would recommend that some developer pick up a 2.3 device at the dollar store or something just to be able to test for compatibility. Maybe it's not a priority as 2.3 is kind of old now, but it supports the NDK and most of the phones from them have the same hardware as now so I don't really see any reason for them to be incapable of running Godot.)

Has anyone else tested Godot on a 2.3 device?

data.title: Added a setting in editor defining scene tabs close button policy. Fixes #3777
data.body:
global/always_show_close_button_in_scene_tabs
Default = OFF --> Close button only on active tab
ON --> Close button on all tabs

data.title: Error in the remove_child() function when using "Visible Collision Shapes"
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Windows

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When I use the remove_child() function i get an error when "Visible Collision Shapes" is enabled

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create 3d scene
- add staticBody with cube collider
- activate "Visible Collision Shapes"

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16718859/13184726/c873b42c-d73d-11e5-9bfc-fc57d4e61ae3.png)
- attach a script like this one:

``` python
extends StaticBody
var bool = true
func _ready():
    set_process(true)
func _process(delta):
    if Input.is_key_pressed(KEY_L)and bool:
        remove_child(get_child(0))
                bool = false
```

Then I get this error:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16718859/13184803/398b0a66-d73e-11e5-9122-5a59e953d45a.png)

data.title: Godot UI improvements [Mockups]
data.body:
Godot UI, despite being nice, could use space better, so I've made a couple of mockups to give an idea where environment could be better. Nothing ambitious, just little changes to make space for what matters the most (Viewport area and sidebar).

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/13177626/018fc2f2-d723-11e5-9952-ea8d615bfa44.png)
This one has all the elements on top bar (which, to be honest, could hold even Play Project group to give more space for scene tabs). It adds to mouse movement between animation player and animation button but looks pretty clean. 
![untitled1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/13178109/e1b11cee-d725-11e5-8bee-9b0c52090166.png)
In this mockup Animation, Output and Debugger elements are left on bottom, which adds to mouse movements to them, but makes bottom bar popping up a bit more intuitive. Scroll bar is moved a little bit. 

Also, I'd like to talk about right click and drag-n-drop friendly nodes in scene tree. Right click is just not used in Godot for some reason. Presenting all the buttons right away is nice and all, but there's a hardware button that can give so much more. 
- Some of the options (Delete, Reparent, Node connections, Node groups, Replace by another type, Duplicate) can be placed in contextual menu on right click. 
- Reparenting should be possible with dragging nodes inside the tree. 
- Right click on resources in the FileSystem tab should open up a menu with rename or move, delete, view owners. 
- By dragging and dropping files in folders people should be able to move resources.
- Right click on element inside the scene should open up a contextual menu that shows node type, name and script bound to the node (with quick option to jump to script).

This way it's possible to reduce the overall amount of all the buttons (or give more ways to get to a feature for a user).

data.title: OS.set_video_mode() not working on Android
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Samsung Galaxy Tab S with Android 5.0.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Changing video modes in runtime is not working on Android devices. Same funcionality for Windows, Linux and OSX works fine.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Run a game on android
- Try to change resolution from a script using OS.set_video_mode() to one that is different

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
http://w84death.itch.io/tanks-of-freedom - game built with default settings should adapt to low-resolution screen (less than 1280x720)
I will prepare smaller demo for easier debug

data.title: Close [x] icon on every scene tab
data.body:
I think it would be more straightforward to have [x] icon on every tab. Currently when I need to close some tab I need to make 2 clicks, and further more when using 'open dominant script on scene change', I'm ending up with closed scene but opened script.  Also when looking how other software deals with this, browsers have 'x' visible on default. Some text editors like Atom hide 'x' by default, but shows it on mouse hover. Don't know any other program that force me to open tab first when I want to close it.
Know not every body will like this idea, that's why I opened the issue. What do you think?

data.title: RichTextLabel append text problem
data.body:
Arch Linux x64

When I try to append text in any possible way to a rich text label, the first line will be a duplicate of all contents with no escape characters and other lines will be the new content.
To reproduce, try to append text to a rich text label!

I'm using [this commit](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/f88d7a0df7d28ff5572173ba3e496907de79bb04)
![Screenshot](http://up.vbiran.ir/uploads/35432145587238927735_DeepinScreenshot20160219121213.png)

data.title: Bug: rotating Light2D affects LIGHT_VEC
data.body:
Windows 10 64bit.
Normal mapping works fine when all lights are omni. It's not that easy when trying to achieve spotlights.

![Figure 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17331426/13169461/fb0a0718-d6e5-11e5-9d9c-f75affee65e0.gif)
As the light rotates, the bricks begin to be lit from the wrong side.

The LIGHT_VEC constant in light shader gets altered on light rotation. If my understanding is correct, it should remain the same.

[example_scene.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/137664/example_scene.zip)

data.title: Fix allocation bug
data.body:
- Add overflow checked intrinsic abstractions that check on overflow.
- Use them for memory allocation code.
- Use size_t type for memory allocation code to support full platform dependent width.

Fixes #3756.

data.title: Reject any native video player calls on iOS that point to files withi…
data.body:
…n .pck archives.

Fix the paths for both res:// and user:// specified video files.

This is a rewrite of https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/3769
Instead of copying the files out of the .pck files, we just reject instead with a notification that explains why.

data.title: Moves a video file from res:// directories to user:// directories in …
data.body: …order for the native iOS video player to be able to read them. Native video player won't work with packed files as far as I know.

data.title: Unexpected default font size behavior in script editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device:**
Xubuntu 14.04 LTS 64-bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Already opened scenes use smaller editor's font than the newly opened one.

**Steps to reproduce:**
~~Make sure not to have set your custom font in text editor's setting.~~

Start to edit the platformer or simple shooter demo.
Go to Scene menu and use Open scene to load one of the xml scenes. 
The font looks like this:
![fonts_normal](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11817561/13165260/d74655e0-d6bb-11e5-99d0-90fc952fa64b.png)

Load and open another xml scene in the editor.
Now, when you go back to the previously loaded scene, the font is smaller:
![fonts_smaller](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11817561/13165265/e2acee62-d6bb-11e5-81fe-79870fc5a0f5.png)

data.title: HTTPClient Headers - Discussion
data.body:
The HTTPClient makes the whole header to lower case that destroys one of my header values(linux path to a file)

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/3db379376fd55a1d5851bf6172affd0765b67b7c/core/io/http_client.cpp#L310

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5258977/are-http-headers-case-sensitive

So maybe godot could provide the raw header and one that is to_lower() or leave the header as he is.

data.title: Can't debug inner classes with breakpoints
data.body:
If the class is declared in the first script and then create it in another script, we can not put a breakpoint.

Example:
file a.gd

```
extends Node

class Test:
   var i = 0
   func _init(i):
      self.i = i # breakpoint does not work
```

file: b.gd

```
extends Node

func _ready():
   var n = get_node("../test")
   var t = n.Test.new(10)
```

data.title: For loop with true iterators instead of arrays
data.body:
Often need a simple classic "for" both "с".
Create an array and a listing of the iterator is not the best option. It's slow and consumes a lot of memory. A realization of the cycle through "while" is not always convenient.

Discuss?

data.title: Unsaved script changes are lost after window focus loss on Windows
data.body:
[en]
Often there is a situation when, after revisions in the script, the script file is not overwritten. The disc appears next to the script file highlighted with the extension TMP. It contains all the latest changes. Fail And the script does not change. In this situation, when you run the project performed original Fail without new changes.

[ru]
Часто возникает ситуация когда после правок в скрипте, файл скрипта не перезаписывается. На диске рядом с скриптом появляется фаил с расширением tmp. Он содержит все последний правки. А сам фаил скрипта не меняется. В такой ситуации при запуске проекта выполняется оригинальный фаил без новых изменений.

commit: b28fc0a3d826165cbc4f49ffdb1419a477d7cdb0
os: win 10 64

data.title: Shouldn't Array::pop_front() and pop_back() return pop-ed element?
data.body:
It seems that pop methods from Array only resize the array, but don't return the actual pop-ed element. What's the point of these methods if they just call Array::resize() ?

https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/array.cpp#L275

data.title: Tooltip offset in editor is too close
data.body:
When I'm typing code, the code completion tooltip is above where I'm typing and too close for my liking. Ideally, it should be below where I'm typing so that I can see the line I've just typed so I can see variable names etc instead of having to hit ESC to see them, but the main issue is it's too close. This is on Linux if that makes any difference. It may be fine on other operating systems.
Ideally, I'd like to see a setting in the "editor settings" window for "editor tooltip y-offset".
exhibit A: http://i.imgur.com/u2BXq7L.png
Thank you.

data.title: Current master is not compiling on Linux
AnimationTreePlayer: blend value tracks (intended to close #2299)
data.body:
Someone should check this to make sure I'm not doing something stupid...I added the following methods to Variant:
- zero() sets a Variant to the appropriate type of zero value
- blend() blends part of one Variant on top of another (a + k*b)

Then I used them to clear/blend values for value tracks in AnimationTreePlayer::_process_animation. I have two questions:

blend() doesn't handle arrays and strings the way interpolate does. Is it possible to create string or int array (real array etc) keys on an animation?

Does every element of an AnimationTreePlayer's track_map have a valid property name, or should I be checking for empty/invalid names?
